descr.p: The exeinfo unit implements some cross-platform routines to examine the contents of an executable: information about sections, mapping addresses to loaded modules etc.
It is mainly used by the lineinfo and lnfodwrf unit to examine the binary for debug info.

element.name: TExeFile
element.short: Structure describing the binary.

descr.p: TExeFile is a record used in the various calls of this unit. It contains a file descriptor, and various fields that describe the executable.
The structure of TExeFile is opaque, that is, one shouldn't rely on the exactness of this structure, it may change any time in the future.

element.name: TExeFile.f
element.short: File handle to the executable image on disk.

element.name: TExeFile.size
element.short: Size of the executable

element.name: TExeFile.isopen
element.short: Is the file handle f open ?

element.name: TExeFile.nsects
element.short: Number of sections in the binary

element.name: TExeFile.sechdrofs
element.short: Section header offset

element.name: TExeFile.secstrofs
element.short: Section strings offset.

element.name: TExeFile.processaddress
element.short: Used on BEOS only

element.name: TExeFile.FunctionRelative
element.short: Internal variable

element.name: TExeFile.ImgOffset
element.short: Image offset

element.name: TExeFile.filename
element.short: Filename of binary file

element.name: TExeFile.buf
element.short: Buffer used in internal read operations

element.name: TExeFile.bufsize
element.short: Size of internal buffer

element.name: TExeFile.bufcnt
element.short: Number of bytes in the buffer.

element.name: OpenExeFile
element.short: Open an executable file

descr.p: OpenExeFile opens the executable file fn and initializes the structure e for subsequent calls to routines in the exeinfo unit.
The function returns True if the file was opened successfully, false otherwise.

element.name: OpenExeFile.Result
element.short: True if the file was opened successfully, false otherwise.

element.name: OpenExeFile.e
element.short: Record to be used in other calls in this unit.

element.name: OpenExeFile.fn
element.short: Name of file to be opened.

element.name: FindExeSection
element.short: Find a section in the binary image.

descr.p: FindExeSection examines the binary that was opened with (represented by e) and searches for the section named secname. If found, the section offset is returned in secofs and the section length (in bytes) is returned in seclen.
The function returns True if the section was found, False if not.

element.name: FindExeSection.Result
element.short: True if the section was found, False if not

element.name: FindExeSection.e
element.short: Record representing the opened executable image

element.name: FindExeSection.secname
element.short: Name of section that must be found

element.name: FindExeSection.secofs
element.short: Offset of the section in the binary image.

element.name: FindExeSection.seclen
element.short: Length of the section in bytes.

element.name: CloseExeFile
element.short: Close a previously opened file.

descr.p: CloseExeFile closes an executable file image previously opened with , and represented by e.
The function returns True if the file was closed successfully, or False if something went wrong.

element.errors: In case of an error, False is returned.

element.name: CloseExeFile.Result
element.short: True if the file was closed successfully, False if not.

element.name: CloseExeFile.e
element.short: Executable to be closed

element.name: ReadDebugLink
element.short: Read the location of a debug info filename

descr.p: ReadDebugLink examines the .gnu_debuglink section to see if the debug information is stored in an external file. If so, then the name of the file with the debug information is returned in the dbgfn parameter.
The function returns false if there is no external debug information file, or if the file with debug information does not exist. It is searched next to the binary file or in the current directory.

element.name: ReadDebugLink.Result
element.short: True if the file with debug information was found, False if not.

element.name: ReadDebugLink.e
element.short: Handle on the open application binary.

element.name: ReadDebugLink.dbgfn
element.short: Name of the file with the debug information.

element.name: GetModuleByAddr
element.short: Return the module name by address
element.descr: GetModuleByAddr returns the name of the module that contains address addr. If successful, it returns True and returns the filename in FileName and the base address at which it is loaded in BaseAddr.

element.name: GetModuleByAddr.addr
element.short: Address to examine

element.name: GetModuleByAddr.baseaddr
element.short: Base address at which module is loaded.

element.name: GetModuleByAddr.filename
element.short: FileName of the module at address addr.
